intro: Lobelia broussonetia, commonly known as the purple lobelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Lobelia broussonetia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
